text:
This is a 65 yo M with h/o MDS who is day +68 s/p nonablative matched
   unrelated donor stem cell transplant complicated by acute GVHD of the
   skin and gut who initially presented with FTT and now is transferred to
   the [**Hospital Unit Name 4**] in setting of worsening respiratory distress and hypoxia.
   Following his transplant on [**2126-4-11**], the patient has been nearly
   continuously hospitalized for complications of GVHD. This current
   admission has been complicated by worsening diarrhea [**2-4**] GVHD in
   setting of attempts to wean down on steroids due to concern for a
   possible occult infection as the patient was complaining of a cough and
   weakness, intermittent AMS that was thought to be [**2-4**] delirium after
   CT/MRI of the head were unrevealing. Pt had increased o2 requirements
   [**6-18**] and was transferred to [**Wardname **] 4 ICU for further workup.  Positive for
   parainfluenza.
   Diarrhea
   Assessment:
   Pt with continuous liquid diarrhea, slowed around 0100
   Action:
   Offered pt fecal incontinence bag, on bedpan as needed, am electrolytes
   sent
   Response:
   Pt refused fecal incontinence bag at this time will continue to use
   bedpan as needed, diarrhea slowing as noted above from 3x/hr at
   beginning of shift to every couple of hours later on
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor, pt with GVHD, ongoing, pt on SS for electrolyte
   repletion
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   Obtained pt on cool aerosol at 70% with FM, breath sounds with rhonchi
   in upper lobes dim at bases, non-productive cough, pt denies SOB except
   when laying on side, O2 sats 91-98%
   Action:
   Trending ABGs, titrating O2 as tolerated, 20mg IVP lasix given 0230, pt
   being ruled out for TB, changed to negative pressure room and placed on
   airborne precautions, induced sputum sent, AM cxray
   Response:
   Pt initially tolerating fiO2 of 50%, noted to be desating to low 90s
   and then mid 80s around 0000, fiO2 increased to 70 and then 100% in
   response, ABG obtained and pt placed on NRB, O2sats on NRB 95-98%,
   lasix given as noted above
   Plan:
   Bronch today, f/u culture data, continue to trend ABGs, titrate
   supplemental O2 as tolerated
